messages.subject: Minamoto Yoritomo
messages.msgSnippet: I think I have some information on Minamoto Yoritomo, that s when he started the first shogunate, which was the foundation for other shogunates, including the
messages.messageBody:
I think I have some information on Minamoto Yoritomo, that's when he
started the first shogunate, which was the foundation for other
shogunates, including the Tokugawa shogunate. Historians thought
Minamoto Yoritomo died in battle, but he didn't die in battle, he died
from injuries from a horsing accident in 1199. It would be great for
my book I'm writing, it's that I need to know what Minamoto Yoritomo's
childhood was like, that's all I need for my book.

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Re: Minamoto Yoritomo
messages.msgSnippet: ...  I can t believe I said Muromachi instead of Kamakura .... sigh. I have to go commit seppuku now. Please excuse me... Tony
messages.messageBody:
"M.Nakazaki" wrote:

>
> > The Muromachi shogunate was the product of Hojo engineering,
>
> Muromachi shogunate was by Ashikaga Takauji, 1338.
> (I found no english page with picture)
>
> Minamoto Yoritomo started Kamakura shogunate in 1192.

<smacking forehead>

I can't believe I said "Muromachi" instead of "Kamakura".... sigh.

I have to go commit seppuku now. Please excuse me...

Tony

messages.messageBody:
Hello, it's pretty much okay with me because I'm
afraid to getting facts mixed up, I do appreciate the
help and sites. I'll continue some research on this
subject, thank for the help, it helps me a lot.

messages.subject: Re: Minamoto Yoritomo
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, ... I do agree with Tony, but if you think it s OK with you, here s some search result for you, Andrea.
messages.messageBody:
Hi,

> You're writing a book on Yoritomo and yet you're asking people whose
> veracity and limit of knowledge is untestable to tell you about him?

I do agree with Tony, but if you think it's OK with you, here's some search
result for you, Andrea.
http://www.google.co.jp/search?sourceid=navclient&hl=ja&q=%8C%B9%97%8A%92%A9
Note:these results are in Japanese. Some pages may have english version.

Following is just for record:

> The Muromachi shogunate was the product of Hojo engineering,

Muromachi shogunate was by Ashikaga Takauji, 1338.
(I found no english page with picture)

Minamoto Yoritomo started Kamakura shogunate in 1192.
http://www.kyohaku.go.jp/meihin/kaiga/shozo/mht5903e.htm
(Portrait of Minamoto Yoritomo)
......Anyway, Hojo took control over Kamakura Shogunate later.
------------------------------
M.Nakazaki
afn_mgr@...

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Minamoto Yoritomo
messages.msgSnippet: ... Don t take this wrong, but... um.... You re writing a book on Yoritomo and yet you re asking people whose veracity and limit of knowledge is untestable to
messages.messageBody:
andrea Smith wrote:

> I'm writing a book on how Minamoto Yoritomo became the
> Shogun that had set the foundations of other
> Shogunates in later years. I just need help on where
> to go now from where I began, can you tell me more
> about Minamoto Yoritomo, please?

Don't take this wrong, but... um....

You're writing a book on Yoritomo and yet you're asking people whose
veracity and limit of knowledge is untestable to tell you about him? Aren't
you doing research?

And, for the record, it is arguable that Yoritomo had little or nothing to
do with the shogunate as it eventually evolved. The Muromachi shogunate was
the product of Hojo engineering, and was a very different structural and
functional animal from the shogunate of the Tokugawa, for example.

Tony
